grammarPoints.meaning: archaic imperfect subjunctive with tense agreement
grammarPoints.usage: Classical literary French with precise temporal concordance
grammarPoints.example: Je souhaitais qu'il eût pu venir
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I wished that he had been able to come

grammarPoints.usage: Highly formal temporal relationships in subjunctive mood
grammarPoints.example: Jusqu'à ce qu'il eût terminé son œuvre, personne ne dormait
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Until he had completed his work, no one slept

grammarPoints.pattern: concordance des temps en discours indirect libre
grammarPoints.meaning: tense concordance in free indirect discourse
grammarPoints.usage: Mixing direct and indirect speech with proper temporal shifts
grammarPoints.example: Il pensait qu'il devrait partir bientôt. Et c'était vrai
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He thought that he should leave soon. And it was true

grammarPoints.meaning: simple past anterior in poetic context
grammarPoints.usage: Literary usage for artistic effect in narrative
grammarPoints.example: À peine eut-il franchi le seuil qu'une vision le terrifia
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He had scarcely crossed the threshold when a vision terrified him

grammarPoints.usage: Classical inversion patterns in conditional expressions
grammarPoints.example: Eût-il eu plus de temps, il aurait réussi
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Had he had more time, he would have succeeded

grammarPoints.usage: Classical literary usage of infinitive for dramatic narration
grammarPoints.example: Et le roi d'ordonner à ses chevaliers de se battre
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: And the king ordered his knights to fight

grammarPoints.pattern: pronom relatif avec antécédent nominalisé complexe
grammarPoints.meaning: relative pronoun with complex nominalized antecedent
grammarPoints.usage: Sophisticated relative constructions with abstract antecedents
grammarPoints.example: La manière dont il procéda, laquelle était révolutionnaire, changeait tout
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: The way he proceeded, which was revolutionary, changed everything

grammarPoints.usage: Omitting verbs in inverted structures for literary effect
grammarPoints.example: Peut-être l'amour, peut-être la crainte
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Perhaps love, perhaps fear

grammarPoints.pattern: ne expletif dans subordonnée en concordance
grammarPoints.meaning: expletive ne in subordinate with tense agreement
grammarPoints.usage: Using ne without negating function in formal subjunctive contexts
grammarPoints.example: Je crains qu'il ne soit plus intelligent que tu ne le saches
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I fear he is more intelligent than you know

grammarPoints.pattern: construction with impersonal verbs in philosophical registers
grammarPoints.usage: Specialized usage of impersonal constructions for abstract reasoning
grammarPoints.example: Il convient d'observer que cette situation révèle les contradictions inhérentes
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: It is fitting to observe that this situation reveals inherent contradictions

grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive expressing negative consequences in formal discourse
grammarPoints.example: Son comportement était tel qu'on eût craint les pires catastrophes
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: His behavior was such that one would have feared the worst disasters

grammarPoints.pattern: accord du participe passé dans constructions complexes
grammarPoints.meaning: past participle agreement in complex structures
grammarPoints.usage: Mastery-level agreement rules for sophisticated constructions
grammarPoints.example: Les difficultés qu'elle eût préférées éviter s'avérèrent insurmontables
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: The difficulties she would have preferred to avoid proved insurmountable

grammarPoints.pattern: subjonctif avec expressions de concession littéraire
grammarPoints.usage: Formal concessive structures in philosophical or literary texts
grammarPoints.example: Encore que la solution fût parfaite, certains la contestaient
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Although the solution was perfect, some contested it

grammarPoints.pattern: prétérit versus imparfait dans narration complexe
grammarPoints.meaning: preterite versus imperfect in complex narration
grammarPoints.usage: Sophisticated distinction between tenses for narrative effect
grammarPoints.example: Dès qu'il entra, le silence tombait. Les regards se tournaient vers lui
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: As soon as he entered, silence fell. Gazes turned toward him

grammarPoints.pattern: subjonctif dans comparaisons avec tournure archéolettré
grammarPoints.meaning: subjunctive in comparisons with archaic constructions
grammarPoints.usage: Classical comparative subjunctive structures
grammarPoints.example: Il était plus courageux qu'on ne le croie possible
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He was braver than one would believe possible

grammarPoints.usage: Infinitive phrase as subject with auxiliary verb for aspect
grammarPoints.example: Avoir poursuivi cette recherche l'avait conduit à découvrir
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Having pursued this research had led him to discover

grammarPoints.usage: Complex pronoun patterns in coordinated structures
grammarPoints.example: Ce qu'il pensait, ce qu'il disait, ce qu'il faisait—tout contredisait
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: What he thought, what he said, what he did—everything contradicted

grammarPoints.pattern: subordonnée participiale avec structure détachée inverse
grammarPoints.meaning: participial subordinate with inverted detached structure
grammarPoints.usage: Sophisticated participial constructions with unusual ordering
grammarPoints.example: Finalement résolu le dilemme qu'on croyait insoluble, il put continuer
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Finally resolved the dilemma one thought insoluble, he could continue

grammarPoints.usage: Conditional expressing ironic or whimsical distance
grammarPoints.example: Cela serait merveilleux, semble-t-il, si tant est que ce fût possible
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: That would be wonderful, it seems, if it were at all possible

grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive expressing what the speaker does by speaking
grammarPoints.example: Que ceci soit enregistré comme acte officiel du tribunal
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Let this be recorded as an official act of the court

grammarPoints.usage: Future perfect in philosophical or abstract speculation
grammarPoints.example: Ayant traversé tous les obstacles, il aura enfin compris la vérité
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Having overcome all obstacles, he will finally have understood the truth

grammarPoints.pattern: relative sans antécédent explicite en contexte
grammarPoints.usage: Sophisticated relative construction with implicit reference
grammarPoints.example: Celui qui connaît tout ignore comment commencer
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He who knows everything is ignorant of how to begin

grammarPoints.usage: Compound past where auxiliary carries meaning
grammarPoints.example: Il y a maintenant trois ans qu'il est allé améliorer sa condition
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: It has now been three years that he went to improve his condition

grammarPoints.pattern: subjonctif dans expression de virtuosité morale
grammarPoints.meaning: subjunctive in expression of moral virtuosity
grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive for expressing idealized moral positions
grammarPoints.example: Qu'on fasse preuve de magnanimité envers les faibles
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Let one show magnanimity toward the weak

grammarPoints.usage: Gerund construction with unusual word order
grammarPoints.example: À cette tâche en se consacrant entièrement, on trouve la vraie satisfaction
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: By devoting oneself entirely to this task, one finds true satisfaction

grammarPoints.meaning: subjunctive with expression of epistemic uncertainty
grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive for expressing doubt about knowledge itself
grammarPoints.example: Je ne saurais affirmer qu'il sût vraiment ce qui se passait
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I cannot assert that he truly knew what was happening

grammarPoints.usage: Participial construction functioning as secondary predicate
grammarPoints.example: Ils restaient assis, attendant le verdict, troublés
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: They remained seated, waiting for the verdict, troubled

grammarPoints.pattern: concordance des modes dans proposition enchâssée
grammarPoints.usage: Proper mood selection in deeply nested structures
grammarPoints.example: Il croyait que tu croisses qu'elle crût au succès
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He believed that you believed that she believed in success

grammarPoints.usage: Infinitive with additional appositive restriction
grammarPoints.example: Attendre indéfiniment, c'est-à-dire sans espoir, n'était pas possible
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Waiting indefinitely, which is to say without hope, was not possible

grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive appearing in formal parenthetical remarks
grammarPoints.example: Cette découverte (bien qu'importante, doit-on dire?) changea tout
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: This discovery (important though it be, one must say?) changed everything

grammarPoints.pattern: imparfait avec valeur de virtuel actualisé
grammarPoints.meaning: imperfect with value of actualized virtual
grammarPoints.usage: Imperfect expressing what could have but did not occur
grammarPoints.example: Un geste de plus et c'était la catastrophe
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: One more gesture and it was disaster

grammarPoints.pattern: pronom relatif composé en apposition disjoint
grammarPoints.meaning: compound relative pronoun in disjunct apposition
grammarPoints.usage: Complex relative apposition with separation
grammarPoints.example: L'idée, auprès de laquelle d'autres semblaient triviales, dominait
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: The idea, in comparison to which others seemed trivial, dominated

grammarPoints.pattern: construction avec ne explicatif en cascade
grammarPoints.usage: Multiple expletive ne appearing in sequence
grammarPoints.example: Je crains qu'il ne craigne qu'elle ne sache que tu refuses
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I fear that he fears that she knows that you refuse

grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive for expressing logical contradictions
grammarPoints.example: Il est impossible qu'un carré soit rond, qu'on le choisisse
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: It is impossible that a square be round, however one might choose it

grammarPoints.usage: Participle expressing concession without explicit conjunction
grammarPoints.example: Reconnaissant l'injustice, il ne la redressait pas
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Acknowledging the injustice, he did not redress it

grammarPoints.usage: Conditional expressing abstract or universal conditions
grammarPoints.example: Si l'homme serait libre, il choisirait selon sa nature
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: If man were free, he would choose according to his nature

grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive in complex double negative expressions
grammarPoints.example: Je ne nie pas qu'il ne soit plus capable
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I do not deny that he is more capable

grammarPoints.usage: Infinitive in complex coordinate structures
grammarPoints.example: Promettre et tenir, voilà l'honneur
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: To promise and to keep, there lies honor

grammarPoints.usage: Present expressing universal truths in formal or literary style
grammarPoints.example: La vertu souffre, le vice prospère, tel est le monde
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Virtue suffers, vice prospers, such is the world

grammarPoints.pattern: imparfait dans narration avec rupture intentionnelle
grammarPoints.meaning: imperfect in narration with intentional rupture
grammarPoints.usage: Imperfect creating deliberate narrative breaks for effect
grammarPoints.example: Il y avait une maison. Elle s'écroule soudain
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: There was a house. It suddenly collapsed

grammarPoints.pattern: subjonctif avec élision du verbe principal
grammarPoints.meaning: subjunctive with ellipsis of main verb
grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive appearing without explicit main verb
grammarPoints.example: Qu'il vienne, ou qu'il ne vienne pas—c'est égal
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Whether he comes or does not come—it is the same

grammarPoints.pattern: participe avec valeur de complément explicatif
grammarPoints.usage: Participle functioning as explanatory complement
grammarPoints.example: Son insistance, poussée à l'extrême, révéla ses intentions
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: His insistence, pushed to the extreme, revealed his intentions

grammarPoints.usage: Conditional for softening or distancing from statements
grammarPoints.example: Cette théorie serait peut-être, dirait-on, un peu simpliste
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: This theory would perhaps, one might say, be a bit simplistic

grammarPoints.pattern: subjonctif avec verbe de perception nié
grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive appearing with negated sensory verbs
grammarPoints.example: Je ne vois pas qu'il soit quelconque
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I do not see that he is mediocre

grammarPoints.pattern: infinitif en début de phrase avec inversion
grammarPoints.usage: Infinitive fronted with subsequent subject inversion
grammarPoints.example: Arriver à cette conclusion, dut-il reconnaître, semblait inévitable
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Reaching this conclusion, he had to acknowledge, seemed inevitable

grammarPoints.pattern: passé simple en mélange temporel dramatique
grammarPoints.meaning: simple past in dramatic temporal mixture
grammarPoints.usage: Simple past creating dramatic effect with temporal shifts
grammarPoints.example: Il arriva. Elle tomba. Le monde changea
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He arrived. She fell. The world changed

grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive in rhetorically charged negative questions
grammarPoints.example: Ne faut-il pas croire qu'il soit sincère?
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Must we not believe that he is sincere?

grammarPoints.usage: Absolute participle specifying the agent
grammarPoints.example: Accepté par tous, le projet put commencer
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Accepted by all, the project could begin

grammarPoints.pattern: conditionnel avec verbe de mouvement lexicalisé
grammarPoints.usage: Conditional using motion verbs in specialized way
grammarPoints.example: Il irait jusqu'à tuer pour son ambition
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He would go so far as to kill for his ambition

grammarPoints.pattern: subjonctif présent après adjectif au comparatif
grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive in comparisons expressing inequality
grammarPoints.example: Il est plus instruit qu'on ne le soupçonne
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He is more learned than one suspects

grammarPoints.usage: Gerund with explicit separate subject
grammarPoints.example: Lui partant, tout s'écroula
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: With him leaving, everything collapsed

grammarPoints.pattern: imparfait avec valeur de narration entrecroisée
grammarPoints.usage: Imperfect managing multiple simultaneous narratives
grammarPoints.example: Tandis qu'il cherchait, elle attendait; lui s'inquiétait, elle espérait
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: While he searched, she waited; he worried, she hoped

grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive expressing restricted applicability
grammarPoints.example: Qu'il soit compétent en mathématiques, c'est vrai, mais en histoire?
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: That he is competent in mathematics is true, but in history?

grammarPoints.pattern: participe passé avec accord phonétiquement motivé
grammarPoints.meaning: past participle with phonetically motivated agreement
grammarPoints.usage: Past participle agreement following specific phonetic patterns
grammarPoints.example: Les œuvres qu'elle a créées résonnaient toujours
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: The works she created still resonated

grammarPoints.pattern: conditionnel dans apodose de phrase contrefactuelle
grammarPoints.meaning: conditional in apodosis of counterfactual sentence
grammarPoints.usage: Conditional expressing consequence of counterfactual condition
grammarPoints.example: Si la Révolution n'avait pas eu lieu, la monarchie persisterait
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: If the Revolution had not occurred, the monarchy would persist

grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive with restriction not explicitly marked
grammarPoints.example: Pourvu que tu viennes
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Provided (that) you come

grammarPoints.usage: Infinitive expressing what the speaker does by speaking
grammarPoints.example: Ne pas déranger
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Do not disturb

grammarPoints.usage: Past anterior used for abstract or philosophical narration
grammarPoints.example: Dès qu'il eût reconnu sa limite, il y renonça
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: As soon as he had recognized his limit, he abandoned it

grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive expressing universal truths with modalization
grammarPoints.example: Qu'on soit riche ou pauvre, on doit mourir
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Whether one is rich or poor, one must die

grammarPoints.usage: Participle carrying expressive modality
grammarPoints.example: Hélas, échouant ainsi, il perd tout espoir
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Alas, failing thus, he loses all hope

grammarPoints.usage: Conditional used in formal correspondence
grammarPoints.example: Je vous demande instamment si vous pourriez m'aider
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I earnestly ask you whether you could help me

grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive with impersonal verbs marking evidence
grammarPoints.example: Il se peut qu'il soit vrai, dit-on
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: It may be that it is true, they say

grammarPoints.usage: Infinitive with reflexive expressing general applicability
grammarPoints.example: C'est difficile à se figurer
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: That is difficult to imagine

grammarPoints.pattern: imparfait dans description avec rupture énonciative
grammarPoints.meaning: imperfect in description with enunciative break
grammarPoints.usage: Imperfect interrupted by shift in narrative stance
grammarPoints.example: Il y avait une forêt. Oui, une véritable forêt
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: There was a forest. Yes, a real forest

grammarPoints.pattern: subjonctif avec expression de virtualité temporelle
grammarPoints.meaning: subjunctive with expression of temporal virtuality
grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive expressing time as hypothesis
grammarPoints.example: Quand même arriverait-il, ce ne serait pas assez tard
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Even should he arrive, it would not be too late

grammarPoints.usage: Participial apposition appearing in various positions
grammarPoints.example: Attendant patiemment, ignorant tout de l'issue, il souriait
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Waiting patiently, ignorant of the outcome, he smiled

grammarPoints.meaning: conditional in expression of subtle irony
grammarPoints.usage: Conditional carrying subtle ironic distance
grammarPoints.example: Cela serait merveilleux, naturellement, si l'on osait y croire
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: That would be wonderful, of course, if one dared believe in it

grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive for expressing what did not happen
grammarPoints.example: Il n'empêche qu'on doive reconnaître la réalité
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Nevertheless, one must acknowledge reality

grammarPoints.usage: Infinitive expressing represented action from specific viewpoint
grammarPoints.example: La voir partir, c'était mourir soi-même
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: To see her leave was to die oneself

grammarPoints.pattern: passé simple avec imparfait en alternance expressive
grammarPoints.meaning: simple past and imperfect in expressive alternation
grammarPoints.usage: Alternating tenses for stylistic and expressive effect
grammarPoints.example: Il entra. Elle regardait par la fenêtre. Ils parlèrent. Le silence tombait
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He entered. She looked out the window. They spoke. Silence fell

grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive expressing intense consequences
grammarPoints.example: Son courage était tel qu'on le crût invincible
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: His courage was such that he was believed invincible

grammarPoints.pattern: participe avec fonction d'attribut du complément
grammarPoints.usage: Participle functioning as secondary predicate
grammarPoints.example: Je l'ai trouvé assis dans le jardin, réfléchissant
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I found him sitting in the garden, reflecting

grammarPoints.pattern: conditionnel dans contexte de politesse distante
grammarPoints.meaning: conditional in context of distant politeness
grammarPoints.usage: Conditional expressing polite distance or deference
grammarPoints.example: Auriez-vous l'amabilité de me renseigner?
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Would you be so kind as to inform me?

grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive in indirect questions
grammarPoints.example: Je me demande s'il soit vraiment venu
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I wonder whether he truly came

grammarPoints.usage: Gerund with complex prepositional modifications
grammarPoints.example: En pensant à ce moment heureux d'autrefois, il souriait
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: In thinking of that happy moment long ago, he smiled

grammarPoints.pattern: imparfait avec valeur de regret contrefactuel
grammarPoints.usage: Imperfect expressing what might have been with regret
grammarPoints.example: Si seulement je partais ce jour-là!
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: If only I left that day!

grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive used in contexts of negotiation or persuasion
grammarPoints.example: Qu'on prenne un compromis, personne n'y perdrait
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Should we reach a compromise, no one would lose

grammarPoints.pattern: participe passé avec ellipse du verbe auxiliaire
grammarPoints.usage: Past participle appearing without explicit auxiliary
grammarPoints.example: Accepté sans discussion, le plan put progresser
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Accepted without discussion, the plan could progress

grammarPoints.usage: Conditional limited by counterfactual premise
grammarPoints.example: Je viendrais, si j'étais libéré de mes obligations
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I would come, if I were freed from my obligations

grammarPoints.pattern: subjonctif dans environnement de doute radical
grammarPoints.meaning: subjunctive in environment of radical doubt
grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive expressing fundamental skepticism
grammarPoints.example: Je doute profondément qu'il existe une seule vérité
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I deeply doubt that a single truth exists

grammarPoints.usage: Infinitive as subject expressing an example
grammarPoints.example: Mentir régulièrement, c'est perdre toute crédibilité
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Lying regularly is losing all credibility

grammarPoints.pattern: passé antérieur dans narration de succession rapide
grammarPoints.meaning: past anterior in rapid succession narrative
grammarPoints.usage: Past anterior for rapid sequence in sophisticated narration
grammarPoints.example: Il eut à peine terminé que tous applaudirent
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He had scarcely finished when all applauded

grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive expressing varying degrees of certainty
grammarPoints.example: Il se peut qu'il vienne, mais c'est peu probable
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He may come, but it is unlikely

grammarPoints.pattern: participe présent en prédicat second absolu
grammarPoints.meaning: present participle as absolute secondary predicate
grammarPoints.usage: Participle functioning as secondary predicate without clear subject
grammarPoints.example: Le temps passant, l'espoir s'évanouissait
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: As time passed, hope vanished

grammarPoints.usage: Conditional in reported modalized statements
grammarPoints.example: Il aurait dit qu'il reviendrait dans une semaine
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He reportedly said he would return in a week

grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive carrying performative force
grammarPoints.example: Que justice soit faite sans délai
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Let justice be done without delay

grammarPoints.pattern: infinitif avec valeur de continuation narrative
grammarPoints.usage: Infinitive advancing narrative action
grammarPoints.example: Et de poursuivre son chemin vers l'inconnu
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: And to continue his path toward the unknown

grammarPoints.usage: Imperfect managing multiple simultaneous viewpoints
grammarPoints.example: Elle l'attendait, lui ne venait pas; elle espérait, lui oubliait
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: She waited for him, he did not come; she hoped, he forgot

grammarPoints.pattern: subjonctif avec tournure de réserve logique
grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive expressing logical caveats
grammarPoints.example: Tout individu soit-il libre de penser, il doit respecter autrui
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Although any individual be free to think, they must respect others

grammarPoints.pattern: participe avec fonction de complément nominalisé
grammarPoints.usage: Participle functioning as nominal complement
grammarPoints.example: L'action de terminer le projet semblait impossible
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: The action of completing the project seemed impossible

grammarPoints.usage: Conditional expressing alienation or strangeness
grammarPoints.example: Ce serait étrange qu'il revînt maintenant
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: It would be strange if he returned now

grammarPoints.meaning: subjunctive in gradually increasing semantic complexity
grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive in progressively complex semantic environments
grammarPoints.example: Il doute que tu crois qu'il sache que c'est vrai
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He doubts that you believe that he knows that it is true

grammarPoints.pattern: infinitif avec ellipse de sujet réfléchi
grammarPoints.meaning: infinitive with ellipsis of reflexive subject
grammarPoints.usage: Infinitive with omitted reflexive pronoun
grammarPoints.example: Il ne peut [s']empêcher de rire
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He cannot help but laugh

grammarPoints.usage: Compound past with unexpected or archaic auxiliaries
grammarPoints.example: Il s'en est allé pour toujours
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He went away forever

grammarPoints.pattern: subjonctif après négation de certitude absolue
grammarPoints.meaning: subjunctive after negation of absolute certainty
grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive expressing what one cannot absolutely assert
grammarPoints.example: Je n'affirme pas qu'il soit faux
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I do not assert that it is false

grammarPoints.pattern: participe présent en fonction de quasi-verbe
grammarPoints.usage: Participle approximating verbal status
grammarPoints.example: Le roi s'avançant majestueusement salua l'assemblée
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: The king, advancing majestically, greeted the assembly

grammarPoints.pattern: conditionnel dans expression de virtualité sociale
grammarPoints.meaning: conditional in expression of social virtuality
grammarPoints.usage: Conditional expressing social possibilities or courtesies
grammarPoints.example: Aurait-on besoin de vous, nous vous contacterions
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Should we need you, we would contact you

grammarPoints.pattern: subjonctif avec structure de renvoi itératif
grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive in iteratively referenced clauses
grammarPoints.example: Quoique tu viennes ou que tu restes, c'est la même chose
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Whether you come or whether you stay, it is the same thing

grammarPoints.meaning: infinitive in context of logical inference
grammarPoints.usage: Infinitive in contexts of reasoning or inference
grammarPoints.example: Connaître cette vérité, c'est être transformé
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: To know this truth is to be transformed

grammarPoints.pattern: imparfait avec valeur de suspense narratif
grammarPoints.usage: Imperfect creating narrative tension
grammarPoints.example: Il y avait quelque chose de louche. Personne n'osait bouger
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: There was something suspicious. No one dared move

grammarPoints.pattern: subjonctif dans domaine de l'éthique abstraite
grammarPoints.meaning: subjunctive in realm of abstract ethics
grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive in abstract ethical statements
grammarPoints.example: Qu'on soit honnête, voilà le fondement de la morale
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: That one be honest, there lies the foundation of morality

grammarPoints.usage: Absolute participle with agent left implicit
grammarPoints.example: Les portes fermées, personne ne pouvait entrer
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: With doors closed, no one could enter

grammarPoints.usage: Conditional expressing surprising or paradoxical possibilities
grammarPoints.example: Il ferait mieux, bien sûr, en s'abstenant
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He would do better, of course, by refraining

grammarPoints.pattern: subjonctif après verbe de production verbale
grammarPoints.meaning: subjunctive after verb of verbal production
grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive following verbs of saying, telling
grammarPoints.example: Il a crié que la maison brûlait, bien qu'elle ne brûlât point
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He shouted that the house was burning, though it was not

grammarPoints.usage: Nominalized infinitive with complex determiners
grammarPoints.example: Ce continuel recommencer épuisait tout le monde
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: This constant recommencing exhausted everyone

grammarPoints.pattern: passé simple dans énoncé de résolution
grammarPoints.meaning: simple past in utterance of resolution
grammarPoints.usage: Simple past expressing resolved action in formal contexts
grammarPoints.example: Il se leva et déclara sa conviction inébranlable
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He stood and declared his unshakeable conviction

grammarPoints.pattern: subjonctif dans environnement de relativité perspectiviste
grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive expressing perspective-dependent truth
grammarPoints.example: De ce point de vue, il soit important; de celui-ci, insignifiant
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: From this viewpoint, it is important; from that one, insignificant

grammarPoints.pattern: participe avec valeur de modifieur d'événement
grammarPoints.usage: Participle modifying entire event or situation
grammarPoints.example: Arrivé tard, il manqua tout le spectacle
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Having arrived late, he missed the entire show

grammarPoints.pattern: conditionnel dans contexte de révision théorique
grammarPoints.meaning: conditional in context of theoretical revision
grammarPoints.usage: Conditional in academic or theoretical statements subject to revision
grammarPoints.example: On dirait que la théorie serait correcte, à condition de réviser ses prémisses
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: One would say the theory were correct, on condition of revising its premises

grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive expressing obligation in formal discourse
grammarPoints.example: Il est obligatoire que l'on respecte les traités
